definition: to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward

sentences.english: The chang college can't continue the operation, he was an outlaw the task of lecturer.
sentences.chinese: 基昌的学院无法再持续运营，他四处探问讲师的任务。

sentences.english: They inquired about the matter time and again.
E. g. It is ill-mannered to ask personal questions.
sentences.chinese: 探问别人隐私是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: You would not necessarily know the causing fprofessionings: but you would know where to semid-foot.
sentences.chinese: 固然你一定了解病因，但你领会从哪里着手探问。

sentences.english: Yesterday, the Duke sent round to enquire after me, and he came himself this morning.
sentences.chinese: 昨天公爵派人来探问我的病情，今天早上他自己来了。

sentences.english: It is ill-mannered to ask personal questions.
sentences.chinese: 探问别人隐私是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: Xiao dream I go to seek resolution of the whereabouts of girl.
sentences.chinese: 晓梦决议本人去探问妞妞的下落。

sentences.english: I will cherish my visit here in memory make sure that I live.
sentences.chinese: 我将会永生永世珍惜我探问此地留下的记忆。

definition: to visit/to go to see what's going on
to make inquiries/to try to find out/to pry
to sound sb out/to find out by tactful indirect questioning
to make insinuations/to take an indirect approach (in making inquiries) (idiom)
to make discreet inquiries/to scout out
to sound out opinions/to get sb's views by polite or indirect questioning
to inquire about/to give sb the third degree
to ask about/to make some inquiries/to ask around
to speculate/to surmise/to wonder whether/to guess
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to pry into/to spy on/to probe into
